snippet: A war crimes tribunal sentenced a senior leader of Bangladesh’s biggest Islamist party to life in prison, in a trial that reopened the wounds of Bangladesh’s 1971 independence war.
abstract: War crimes tribunal sentences Abdul Quader Molla, senior leader of Bangladesh's biggest Islamist party, to life in prison for abuses during Bangladesh's 1971 war to break away from Pakistan.
lead_paragraph: A war crimes tribunal sentenced a senior leader of Bangladesh’s biggest Islamist party to life in prison, in a trial that reopened the wounds of Bangladesh’s 1971 independence war.

headline.seo: Life Sentence in Bangladesh War Crimes Trial
